items.description: River Yeo and River Parrett Moors around Muchelney and Thorney
items.message: The Yeo and Parrett rivers remain high following rainfall on Tuesday As a result, this Flood Alert remains in force. The remainder of Wednesday and Thursday will be mainly dry with further showers forecast on Friday 12/12/25. The current river level at Huish Episcopi pumping station is 8.90m and is stable. The current drain level at Huish Episcopi pumping station is 7.39m and is rising. Flooding will affect the road from Langport to Muchelney if this level exceeds 7.3m; the road from Muchelney to Long Load above 7.86m; the road from Muchelney to Thorney above 7.93m and the road from Muchelney to Drayton above 8.8m. We continue to monitor rainfall and river levels. We will commence pumping when river levels allow. Avoid driving through flood water. Refer to the local authority website for any local road closures. This message will be updated by 2:00PM on 11 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: Groundwater flooding in the West of Dorset
items.message:
Rising groundwater levels may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible in the Cerne Valley, Hooke and Sydling areas 
Groundwater levels from Dickley Down borehole have risen to 164m in response to recent heavy rainfall. Levels may continue to rise and flooding of fields and roads is possible. Levels are reactive to further rainfall. No significant rainfall is expected over the next couple of days which could see levels fall.

Flooding of roads and fields is possible. Where groundwater is near the surface, intense rainfall will lead to surface water flooding. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Residents are advised to prepare property resilience measures and ensure that pumps are working where they have been installed . 
This message will be updated by 4:00PM on 11 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.message: Levels remain high on the Rivers Yeo and Parrett following rainfall on Tuesday. The remainder of Wednesday and Thursday will be mainly dry. Further rainfall is possible on Friday 12/12/25. Flooding may affect low lying land and roads near the River Yeo, River Parrett and River Cary, particularly around the Ilchester to Yeovilton road at the end of the runway. We are monitoring rainfall and river levels . We are clearing blockages from debris screens, bridges and culverts. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 2:00PM on 11 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Yeo and Parrett, Yeovilton to Huish Episcopi
items.message: River levels remain high in the Pen Mill and Ilchester and the lowland areas around Long Load and Huish Episcopi. The remainder of Wednesday and Thursday will be mainly dry. Further rainfall is possible on Friday 12/12/25. Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the River Yeo, River Parrett , with low lying land and roads expected to be most affected, particularly around the A37 south and A303 south west of Ilchester. The Ilchester to Limington road and road to Ilchester Meads. There is also a risk of flooding at Hainbury Mill, Ilchester. Water reaches bottom of ringbanks at Ilchester Meads and Ilchester. We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary. We are checking defences, bridges, culverts and screens. We will pump when river levels allow. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. Act on your flood plan if you haven't already. This message will be updated by 2:00PM on 11 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.message: Levels remain high on the Rivers Yeo and Parrett following rainfall on Tuesday. River and drain levels are still high in the lowland areas around Huish Episcopi, Langport, the River Sowy and King's Sedgemoor. The remainder of Wednesday and Thursday will be mainly dry. Further rainfall is possible on Friday 12/12/25. This flood alert will remain in force whilst levels remain high. Flooding will affect areas near the Rivers Yeo, Parrett, Kings Sedgemoor Drain and Sowy, with low lying land and roads most affected, including Westover Trading Estate at Langport. We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. We are checking defences, bridges, culverts and screens. We will commence pumping when river levels allow. Take care and avoid driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 1.00PM on 11 December 2025 or as the situation changes.
